intro: Chaetospora alpina, commonly known as the alpine chaetospora, is a small, perennial herbaceous plant native to high-altitude regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, fern-like leaves and tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and mountainous areas. Due to its delicate structure, it is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds typical of its habitat.
